DOC.brief_summary: This randomize clinical trial study peer navigator education improve survivorship care African American breast cancer survivor . An educational intervention involve peer group may help improve well-being quality life ( QOL ) breast cancer survivor
DOC.brief_title: Peer Navigator Education Improving Survivorship Care African American Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate ability peer navigation ( PN ) improve understand survivorship care planning ( SCP ) 6 month . II . To promote adherence SCP schedule follow-up examination 12 month . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To evaluate effect PN change baseline medical efficacy , preparedness life new survivor , physical health relate QOL 6 month . OUTLINE : PNs train medical issue resource , SCP . Participants randomize 1 2 treatment arm . ARM I : Participants receive 4 PN session tailor need follow 6 month booster session American Cancer Society ( ACS ) material . ARM II : Participants receive ACS material . After completion study treatment , patient follow 6 12 month .
DOC.criteria: TRIAL SUBJECTS : Patient age 18 year old selfidentifies AfricanAmerican In early survivorship phase , define 112 month post completion treatment stage 03 breast cancer Receiving health care primarily health maintenance organization ( HMO ) Patients metastatic cancer second primary cancer , medical characteristic ( e.g . disease progression ) significantly different Breast cancer survivor ( BCS ) major disable medical , psychiatric , substance abuse condition ( e.g. , anxiety , depression , alcohol/tobacco problem ) exclude PEER NAVIGATORS : At least 25 year age selfidentifies AfricanAmerican Previously participate type research study Has least high school education Has diagnose breast cancer , currently remission eradicate Belongs breast cancer support group Has valid driver 's license Owns operational vehicle Has access personal computer internet access
